p: Scientific information regarding the chemical constituents of walnut root is scarce because this part of the tree is not easily available. Alkaloids, phenols, flavonoids, steroids, terpenoids, tannins, and saponins are the main phytochemicals reported to be present in the walnut root extract [ 21]. The root part of the walnut tree was also investigated as a potent source for obtaining effective antifungal or antibacterial constituents. The prepared methanolic extracts derived from the walnut root are effective against common uropathogenic bacteria causing urinary tract infections (UTIs) [ 129] and different types of Candida strains [ 21].
